definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: The magician riffled through the cards with skilful fingers that moved like lightning.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师用熟练的手指闪电般地洗牌。

sentences.english: Daqiang is the most skillful of all the workers here.
sentences.chinese: 大强是这里所有的工人当中最熟练的。

sentences.english: Her craftsmanship improved and she mastered her sketching techniques.
sentences.chinese: 她的手艺提高了，还熟练地掌握了草图素描法。

sentences.english: But the Chinese, some experts say, are notably adept.
sentences.chinese: 但是，一些专家说，中国对此尤为熟练。

sentences.english: The osteopath carefully manipulated my damaged shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 整骨医生仔细而又熟练地给我推拿受伤的肩。

sentences.english: I wasn't sure, but it looked like he smoothly handed her a tip.
sentences.chinese: 我不太敢肯定，但看上去他熟练地给了她一点小费。

sentences.english: They can also be invaluable in creating a well versed cadre of NCOs and Officers.
sentences.chinese: 这样打造出精通熟练的士官和军官干部是非常宝贵的。

sentences.english: Metaphoric competence is an important indication of the mastery of a language.
sentences.chinese: 隐喻能力是人们熟练掌握一种语言的重要标志。

sentences.english: She expertly slid the hypodermic needle into my vein.
sentences.chinese: 她熟练地把注射针插入我的静脉里。

sentences.english: His performance tonight speaks volumes for his skillfulness.
sentences.chinese: 他今晚的表现充分说明他技巧之熟练。

sentences.english: Master the literature search and other accesses to get technology information.
sentences.chinese: 熟练掌握文献检索和其它获取科技信息的方法。

sentences.english: The expertness of her driving surprised him.
sentences.chinese: 她驾驶技术熟练，他感到很惊奇。

sentences.english: Simple operation, convenient maintenance, without the need for skilled workers, that school will be.
sentences.chinese: 操作简单，维护方便，无需熟练工，即学即会。

sentences.english: He has become a skilled worker.
sentences.chinese: 他已经成为一名熟练的工人。

sentences.english: This kind of glasses manufactured by experienced craftsmen wears comfortably.
sentences.chinese: 这种由技术熟练的工匠制作的眼镜，戴起来很舒服。

definition: with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
to have a fluent command of (idiom)
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to immediately put into practice something one has just learned (idiom)
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
